conclusion: Determine the refractive index \( n \) of the semi-cylindrical transparent object using given conditions.

The semi-cylindrical object has a radius \( R \). A thin bundle of monochromatic light enters along the axis \( OA \) from the left. The light ray reaches point \( C \), which is at a distance of \( \frac{\sqrt{3}}{3}R \) from \( O \) on the vertical axis.
The angle of incidence \( \theta_i \) at the interface between air and the semi-cylinder is \( 0^\circ \).
Snell's law states that \( n_1 \sin \theta_i = n_2 \sin \theta_r \).
Since \( \theta_r = 0^\circ \), the light ray travels straight through the semi-cylinder without bending.
The light ray at point \( C \) is tangent to the surface of the semi-cylinder.
The angle \( \phi \) between the line \( OC \) and the vertical axis is such that the light ray just grazes the surface.
In a semi-cylinder, the angle \( \phi \) can be related to the refractive index \( n \) by the equation \( \tan \phi = \frac{1}{n} \).
Using the relationship \( \tan \phi = \frac{1}{n} \), we get \( \frac{1}{n} = \frac{1}{\sqrt{3}} \), so \( n = \sqrt{3} \).
The refractive index of the transparent object is \(\boxed{\sqrt{3}}\).
